p: Numerous plant EOs and their single constituents have been reported to inhibit postharvest fungi in vitro and in vivo. Several researchers reported that some plant EOs can be potentially utilized in controlling some serious phytopathogenic fungi such as B. cinerea [ 73, 74], Aspergillus spp. [ 75], Fusarium spp. [ 76], Penicillium spp. [ 77], and C. gloeosporioides Penz. [ 78].
